meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - it's time to get our otome on!

As I dived into Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling, I couldn't help but think of my fellow critics who have already swooped in with their reviews. Some have praised the game for its sweet (pun intended) storytelling, while others have criticized it for not living up to its predecessor's standards.

But what about our poor reviewer on Gamer Escape? They're feeling a little salty about the whole DLC situation - can we really blame them? I mean, who doesn't love getting more bang for their buck? Still, I'm here to give you the lowdown on whether or not Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is worth your while.

First off, let's talk about the presentation. Oh boy, it's a feast for the eyes! The artwork is simply stunning, with characters that are both swoon-worthy and relatable. And don't even get me started on the soundtrack - I'm pretty sure I've had more than a few late-night jam sessions to the game's catchy tunes.

Now, let's get to the good stuff: the story itself. As some critics have mentioned, it's hard to fully appreciate Sweet and Spicy Darling without having played the original Cupid Parasite. But that doesn't mean newbies can't jump in and enjoy themselves! The game does an excellent job of introducing newcomers to the world and its characters, making it easy to pick up where the previous game left off.

And then there's the romance - oh, the romance! I won't give away too many spoilers, but let's just say that each of the bachelors has their own unique charm, and the endings are simply delightful. Whether you're a sweet-tooth or a spice-lover (or both, like me!), Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling has got you covered.

So, what's the verdict? Well, I think it's safe to say that Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is a must-play for fans of the otome genre - especially those who have already fallen in love with the original. And as for newbies? Don't worry, they'll still find plenty to enjoy!

Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to find some virtual chocolates (because, let's be real, that's what this review is all about).
